resources.title: Cyber Education Project
resources.author: Funded by the National Science Foundation
description: Join an initiative to develop cyber-related curriculums for our youth!
quote: An initiative supported by a diverse group of computing professionals representing academic institutions and professional societies to develop undergraduate curriculum guidelines and a case for accreditation for educational programs [in cyber-related fields]

resources.title: Stay Safe Online
resources.author: National Cybersecurity Alliance
description: How to stay safe online with practical measures.
quote: To educate and empower our global digital society to use the Internet safely and securely.

resources.title: Cybersecurity Education and Career Development
resources.author: From the Department of Homeland Security
description: Thoughts from the Department of Homeland Security on education and careers in cybersecurity related fields.
quote: America needs well trained professionals working in cybersecurity roles. These professionals are critical in both private industry and the government for the security of individuals and the nation.

The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is committed to strengthening the nation’s cybersecurity workforce through standardizing roles and helping to ensure we have well-trained cybersecurity workers today as well as a strong pipeline of future cybersecurity leaders of tomorrow.

resources.title: Cyber Security Education
resources.author: All Star Directories
description: Launch your career in cybersecurity by finding schools and programs that equip students with skills in cybersecurity.
quote: CybersecurityEducation.org provides a searchable database of schools, degrees, programs and career resources.
Our mission is to help you find the degree program and education resources you’ll need to realize your personal goals.

resources.title: CyberPatriot Elementary School Initiative
resources.author: CyberPatriot: National Youth Cyber Education Program
description: Volunteer for the CyberPatriot Elementary School Cyber Education Initiative (ESCEI)!
quote: Like other CyberPatriot programs, the ESCEI aims to excite students about STEM education and careers by teaching them about cybersecurity in an engaging way.

Given the increasing presence of the Internet in society, the program also aims to help students understand the widespread importance of cybersecurity in their everyday lives and equips them with skills to help better protect themselves on the Internet.

resources.title: National Initiative For Cybersecurity Education
resources.author: National Institute of Technology
description: An initiative to educate, train, and build a workforce equipped with the necessary skills for cybersecurity work
quote: The mission of NICE is to energize and promote a robust network and an ecosystem of cybersecurity education, training, and workforce development. NICE fulfills this mission by coordinating with government, academic, and industry partners to build on existing successful programs, facilitate change and innovation, and bring leadership and vision to increase the number of skilled cybersecurity professionals helping to keep our Nation secure.

resources.title: NICERC
resources.author: Academic Division of Cyber Innovation Center
description: NICERC offers professional development for teachers through programs, curricula, and competitions designed for students of various STEM disciplines.
quote: The Cyber Innovation Center, in conjunction with the Louisiana Tech University’s Science and Technology Education Center (SciTEC) in the College of Education, offers an online Cyber Education Certificate program for K-12 educators and administrators.

resources.title: UMD Cybersecurity Club
resources.author: UMD Student Organization
description: Get involved with a student-run club dedicated towards cybersecurity and enabling students with the necessary skills to advance their career.
quote: Our main purpose is to develop and encourage cyber security awareness and application by providing students with the tools and education they need to advance their cyber security careers. To accomplish this goal, we organize community outreach programs about security related topics, host tech talks and guest speakers and participate in security related competitions and conventions.

resources.title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
resources.author: Maryland Cybersecurity Center
description: A course on Coursera developed by the Maryland Cybersecurity Center at UMD, where students can specialize in cybersecurity
quote: The Cybersecurity Specialization covers the fundamental concepts underlying the construction of secure systems, from the hardware to the software to the human-computer interface, with the use of cryptography to secure interactions. These concepts are illustrated with examples drawn from modern practice, and augmented with hands-on exercises involving relevant tools and techniques. Successful participants will develop a way of thinking that is security-oriented, better understanding how to think about adversaries and how to build systems that defend against them.

resources.title: ThreatPost
resources.author: Kaspersky Lab
description: A news source from a cybersecurity firm helping you stay up to date with the latest events in cybersecurity.
quote: Threatpost, The Kaspersky Lab security news service, is an independent news site which is a leading source of informationabout IT and business security for hundreds of thousands of professionals worldwide.

resources.title: WIRED Security
resources.author: WIRED News
description: Stay hip to the latest news related to security with WIRED's journalism on security.
quote: Get in-depth security coverage at WIRED including cyber, IT and national security news.

resources.title: CNET Security News
resources.author: CNET News
description: CNET provides coverage of security-related news so you can stay up to date with the latest security-related events.
quote: CNET news reporters and editors cover the latest in Security, with in-depth stories on issues and events.

resources.title: CompTIA CSA+
resources.author: CompTIA
description: Obtain certification in recognizing and thwarting security threats to advance your career in cybersecurity.
quote: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CSA+) is an international, vendor-neutral cybersecurity certification that applies behavioral analytics to improve the overall state of IT security. CSA+ validates critical knowledge and skills that are required to prevent, detect and combat cybersecurity threats.
